metadata.name: BITS Transfer Job With Uncommon Or Suspicious Remote TLD
metadata.comment: Detects a suspicious download using the BITS client from a FQDN that is unusual. Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM network_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (metadata.event_code = 16403 AND NOT (contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.azureedge.net/')) OR contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.com/')) OR contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('.sfx.ms/')) OR contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('download.mozilla.org/')) OR contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('cdn.onenote.net/')) OR contains(lower(dst_endpoint.hostname), lower('cdn.office.net/'))))

output.summary: Detects a suspicious download using the BITS client from a FQDN that is unusual. Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.

metadata.objective: False positive: This rule doesn't exclude other known TLDs such as ".org" or ".net". It's recommended to apply additional filters for software and scripts that leverage the BITS service References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1197/T1197.md, https://twitter.com/malmoeb/status/1535142803075960832
